text: The men's javelin throw competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Sam Colson of the United States. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |94.58 |Montreal, Canada |July 25, 1976 |- |Pan American Games record | |83.82 |Mexico City, Mexico |1975 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font- size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Duncan Atwood | |84.16 |GR |- | |Antonio González | |84.12 | |- | |Raúl Pupo | |81.96 | |- |4 |Phil Olsen | |76.28 | |- |5 |Amado Morales | |76.00 | |- |6 |Rod Ewaliko | |75.78 | |- |7 |Ramón Garmendia | |72.24 | |- |8 |Denes Pajtas | |65.70 | |- | |Mario Sotomayor | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Men's javelin throw
